item.title: Erin add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "The gods' most savage curses come upon us as answers to our own prayers. Prayer is a dangerous business." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Erin add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "You cannot let your parents anywhere near your real humiliations." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Erin add a quote by Sappho
item.description: "may you sleep on the breast of your delicate friend" -- Sappho

item.title: Erin add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "In itself, homosexuality is as limiting as heterosexuality: the ideal should be to be capable of loving a woman or a man; either, a human being, without feeling fear, restraint, or obligation." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Erin add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "What an odd thing a diary is: the things you omit are more important than those you put in." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Erin add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Innocence ends when one is stripped of the delusion that one likes oneself." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Erin add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "The ability to think for one's self depends upon one's mastery of the language." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Erin add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Let me just be in the ground. Let me just be in the ground and go to sleep." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Erin add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "When I am near the end of a book, I have to sleep in the same room with it." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Erin add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "There's a point when you go with what you've got. Or you don't go." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Erin add a quote by Andrea Gibson
item.description: "Hey, are you a boy or a — never mind, can I have a push on the swing?” And some day, y’all, when we grow up, it’s all gonna be that simple." -- Andrea Gibson

item.title: Erin add a quote by Sappho
item.description: "I would not think to touch the sky with two arms" -- Sappho

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "You read a hundred military manuals you won't find the word kill they trick you into killing." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "He came after Homer and before Gertrude Stein, a difficult interval for a poet." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "They were two superior eels at the bottom of the tank and they recognized each other like italics." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "Then a miracle occurred in the form of a plate of sandwiches. Geryon took three and buried his mouth in a delicious block of white bread filled with tomatoes and butter and salt. He thought about how delicious it was, how he liked slippery foods, how slipperiness can be of different kinds. I am a philosopher of sandwiches, he decided. Things good on the inside." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Erin add a quote by Georg Christoph Lichtenberg
item.description: "Whenever he composes a critical review, I have been told, he gets an enormous erection." -- Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

item.title: Erin add a quote by Georg Christoph Lichtenberg
item.description: "A person reveals his character by nothing so clearly as the joke he resents." -- Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

item.title: Erin add a quote by Georg Christoph Lichtenberg
item.description: "When a book and a head collide and a hollow sound is heard, must it always have come from the book?" -- Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

item.title: Erin add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "O to be self-balanced for contingencies, to confront night, storms, hunger, ridicule, accidents, rebuffs, as the trees and animals do." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Erin add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Slang, too, is the wholesome fermentation or eructation of those processes eternally active in language, by which froth and specks are thrown up, mostly to pass away; though occasionally to settle and permanently chrystallize." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Erin add a quote by danah boyd
item.description: "The things that make us safest from others make us least from ourselves." -- danah boyd
